fields.description: Currently, the "Create Issue" macro allows for rudimentary linking to an epic, but does not have any other options to allow for more robust linking. As a user of this macro, I would like to be able to have an additional option to automatically link the topic to the parent of the normal suggested link (so, the parent of the Epic).
fields.summary: Allow "Create Jira Issue" macro to create links to parent Jira issues on creation

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
Admin can globally configure the date time format for the entire site: [Site date and time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-time-and-date-formats-150144.html#ConfiguringTimeandDateFormats-Sitedateandtime]. However, it would be beneficial to configure these settings for specific spaces. 


h4. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to modify the time and date formatting in a space that will override the global settings.
fields.summary: Allow admin to configure the Time/Date format for spaces.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a label to a page or adding a label to the Page Properties Report macro configuration no results are returned.  


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a Page Properties Report macro into a page 
# Add a label to the label section
# Add the label to another page in the space

h3. Expected Results

The Page Properties Report macro populates with the page containing the label

h3. Actual Results

No results are returned:
 !Screen Shot 2021-11-30 at 1.47.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Additionally to confirm this is not an indexing issue the label can be searched:
 !Screen Shot 2021-11-30 at 1.47.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

(i) it has been observed that existing Page Property Report macro content will continue to function (presumably from prior versions). Just new content is affected.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro Does not Update

fields.description:
It would be useful to include the same warning from the *General Configuration > Backup Configuration* page:
{panel}
(!) Warning: We do not recommend the automatic backup procedure for production installations as a general rule, as it may require a large amount of memory, CPU and disk space.
Instead, we recommend that you perform a manual backup of your Confluence database, home directory and attachments. For more information, please refer to our online documentation.
{panel}
Whilst we always recommend using a production backup strategy regardless, when going to manually backup this warning is not included as it is in the backup config page.
* [Production Backup Strategy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/production-backup-strategy-38797389.html]

It would make sense for this warning to appear for any site backup-related task or direct them to the production backup strategy.
fields.summary: Add a performance warning to the Backup & Restore admin just as in the Backup Configuration admin

fields.description:
Favorite Pages macro seems to be the same as viewmyfavourites.action, sorted by pageid instead of recently added to your favorites list.

Affected version: v7.13.2
fields.summary: favorites page macro do not be sorted according to the list of favorites recently added

fields.description: When setting up a new page our team is using labels to keep things organized. We want to create a list of labels for everyone else to use, but currently you can only create a label when adding it to a page. This becomes an issue when we are creating new pages because people creating the pages may not have the permissions to create new labels and even if they do we would like to keep the labels consistent across the team and only allow for certain labels to be used. I suggest a place where someone with the appropriate permissions can create labels for a space that could then be used by the rest of the members of the space. This would allow you to create a bank of labels for users to add to pages with requiring any of them to be in use upon creation.
fields.summary: Allow for creation of labels without adding them to a page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When searching for Cyrillic "ё" using Find and Replace (keyboard shortcut Ctrl+F (Windows) or Cmd+F (Mac OS) in page editor) results will match "e" as well.

h3. Suggested Solution
Exact search for "ё" should return results for "ё" while "e" should return results for "e"

h3. Why this is important
In Russian, "ё" and "e" are different letters and not dramatically interchangeable

h3. Workaround
No workaround as Chrome and other browsers "Find" features also make the same mistake of interchanging "ё" and "e"
fields.summary: Searching for Cyrillic "ё" in Find and Replace will also return results for "e"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Google Chrome Version 96.0.4664.45 on Windows accidentally dragging anything in front of a Confluence page in reader mode will result in it getting added as an attachment.
For example:
* Clicking on an embedded picture and drag it a bit will result in new image version being uploaded duplicating attachments
* Opening chrome bookmarks, clicking and holding on a bookmark, then releasing will attach bookmark as *.url file
* Drag and dropping one of Confluence pages from page tree

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence and insert an image so it is embedded
# Open Confluence page in Google Chrome 96 from Windows
# Click on the image and drag it
# Click on page in the page tree and drag it over Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
Nothing happens as drag and drop should only happen for files moved from external resource, such as files folder onto a page

h3. Actual Results
# Moved image is re-uploaded as new attachment version
# Drag and dropped page from page tree is attached as *.url file
See recording here:
 [^Recording #3.mp4] 
This leads to a lot of accidental unwanted attachments and attachment versions polluting file system and Confluence

h3. Note
The issue seems to be caused by the new [Chromium feature introduced in version 96|https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/80805a073bc9a7aefca9b6eb5ebf95a9ca11fdb8]. The behavior should be visible with other web applications on the same version of Chromium.

h3. Workaround
The issue is not observed with Chrome v95 or on MacOS.
fields.summary: Drag and Dropping anything above page will add it as an attachment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Long URL link overflows the Confluence page boundaries on mobile devices
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that contains a long URL link. Example:

{code:java}
http://testingsiterandomlink:8095/crowd/console/secure/application/viewdetails!execute.action?ID=884737 {code}
 # Save the page.
 # Access the page using a mobile device. The links overflows

h3. Expected Results

The link does not overflow the page. 

 
h3. Actual Results

The link overflows the page.

!IMG_5C59DC11ECE2-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * Use the insert link macro
 * Display the page using the Mobile mode.
fields.summary: Long URL link overflows the Confluence page boundaries on mobile devices

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
When creating a Support Zip in Confluence Data Center, the nodes are identified by their ID, not their name.

h3. Suggested Solution  
Instead of using the node's id, use the node name field when creating a Support Zip.

h3. Why this is important   
If we have more than a single node, it may be hard to identify what is the node that we are trying to retrieve the Support Zip. We would need to check in the *Clustering* page which node id is equivalent to which name.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Use node name as the identifier when creating Support Zip files in Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer is using Confluence DC. They followed the step 6 of [Upgrading Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf74/upgrading-confluence-data-center-1003129665.html] to copy files from first node to the second one. However, the index was not recovered automatically. 
Seems the processing of index recovery was terminated due to there is a corrupted index file( corruptIndexException: codec header mismatch) in local directory of the second node.
It should be able to be recovered from shared directory or from first node when the index in local is corrupted.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start second node for a cluster
 # There is a corrupted index file in the internal directory of second node

h3. Expected Results

The index should be recovered from share directory or first node.

 
h3. Actual Results

Index recovery was terminated due to below error when recovering index from shared directory. It is very strange why recoverIndexFromSharedHome is terminated due to the corrupted index file in the *internal directory.*  I do not think it should  read  internal directory.
{code:java}
2021-11-04 14:20:20,487 ERROR [Catalina-utility-1] [confluence.impl.index.DefaultIndexRecoveryService] triggerIndexRecovererModuleDescriptors Exception when handling index recovery for module descriptor confluence.sections.admin.indexing:mainIndexRecoverer
...
org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException: codec header mismatch: actual header=255842156 vs expected header=1071082519 (resource: NIOFSIndexInput(_88e2.fnm in path="/opt/wiki/data/index/_88e2.cfs" slice=7325:11481))

...
com.atlassian.confluence.impl.index.DefaultIndexRecoveryService.recoverIndexFromSharedHome(DefaultIndexRecoveryService.java:259)
...
{code}
 
h3. Workaround

[Rebuild the Content Indexes From Scratch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-server-110035351.html]  for the second node.
fields.summary: The processing of Index recovery is terminated due to corruptIndexException(codec header mismatch)

Although Completion: 100 % complete does tell you it is complete, it is normal to have a completion-message or a button to get you back to Frontpage.

!image-2021-11-25-12-12-05-551.png!
fields.summary: After Deleting a space - there is no

fields.description:
Currently, when copying a page, you have to manually edit the page permissions.

It would be great to have a checkbox "Retain page permissions" on the copy page popup:

!image-2021-11-25-08-19-22-594.png|width=451,height=256!

 

*Use case:* 

At our company, we have a space per team.
In the team space, we keep all meeting notes of our monthly one-on-ones. Before a one-on-one, the previous meeting notes are copied, since we keep a certain format, and replaced with the input of the current month.

Right now, when you copy a page, you manually have to alter the permissions and grant access to the team lead and team member.

A couple of times a team member forgot to edit the page permissions and sensitive information was available for everyone in the space.

So a checkbox "Retain page permissions" would really help in our use case.
fields.summary: Add option to retain page permissions when copying a page
Application logs doesn't print an error while importing an existing space

fields.description:
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Created a new page
 # Created a table, insert a long word/links in the table
 # Save the page
 # Export to Word

h3. *Expected Behaviour*

The width of the table should adjust to the page wrapping the long strings/words and it should appear complete in the exported Word file
h3. *Actual Behaviour*

Table gets cut off in the exported Word file if the table has a long word or link

!test-long-string.png|width=325,height=168!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Long words or a link in a table results in the right part of the table cut off in exported Word files

fields.description:
Confluence supports the ability to 'Resolve' inline comments, which is very useful in review workflows. Unfortunately page comments do not have a similar 'Resolve' option. Since Confluence added support to add a quoted page comment as a workaround for the frequent inability to add inline comments to some content, this has become especially annoying, because the only option to clean these up at the end of a review phase is to delete them.

The ability to 'Resolve' page comments would therefore be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Ability to resolve page comments

fields.description:
{panel:title=Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}
This issue tracks the impact of a bug in Chromium based web browsers, on the users of Confluence. The root cause of the issue is a problem in the browser's implementation of the spell check functionality.

This spell check bug is being tracked by the Chromium team at [Issue 1271918: InputMethodController::GetImeTextSpans() is too slow when editable having many spelling errors \- Chromium|https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1271918]

We would encourage you to watch that bug for more detailed updates.
{panel}
h3. Problem
Editing Large Confluence page is extremely slow in browsers built upon *Chromium Version 96* and *Chromium Version 97 Beta* builds. 

Chromium is the underlying browser engine in the below browsers and many others
* Google Chrome 
* New Microsoft Edge
* Brave 
* Vivaldi

A full list of browsers based on Chromium can be viewed at [Chromium (web browser) \- Wikipedia|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chromium_(web_browser)#Browsers_based_on_Chromium]

h3. Environment
Tested with Confluence DC / Server version *7.13.2* and *7.14.1*

The following browser versions are known to be impacted
* Chrome version 96.0.4664.45 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Chrome version 96.0.4664.55 (Official Build)
* Brave Version 1.32.106 Chromium: 96.0.4664.45
* Edge Version 96.0.1054.34 (Official build) (64-bit)
* Any other browsers using Chromium Build 96 or 97 Beta

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a large page in your Confluence instance
 * Edit the page in an affected browser
 ** (i) the issue is easily reproduced in *Incognito mode* as well
 * Try to add new content (text for example) and/or try to scroll up and down on the page

h3. Expected Results
 * Scrolling and adding content operations should stay responsive regardless of the content length

h3. Actual Results
 * It can take several seconds to browse and/or add new content efficiently on a large page
 * Scrolling up and down will result in the page content being rendered "blanked" for a couple of seconds

h3. Workaround
 * Disable spell check on the browser settings
 * Downgrade Browser version
 * Use another browser which is not impacted.

h3. Notes
(i) Issue happens regardless if Collaborative Edition is switched ON or OFF

Confluence Cloud users impacted by this issue can find the associated issue at: [CONFCLOUD\-73213: Performance issues with Chrome 96 and Chrome 97 in Confluence editor|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-73213]
fields.summary: Editing Large Confluence Pages is Extremely Slow on Chromium Based Browsers

In Roadmap Planner you can set the view either by months or by weeks. An additional option for quarters would also be useful here.
This has the advantage that, for example, you also get a clear overview for longer-lasting projects.
fields.summary: Quarter option for Roadmap Planner

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Confluence search works for PPT file if it is bigger than 1MB. But the same does not hold for PPTX file, if the file is more than 1MB.
h3. Environment

.Confluence 7.4.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Confluence and upload a PPTX file of size larger than 1MB.
 # Wait for couple of minutes to ensure indexing is done and perform a name search, content search of the newly uploaded file.
 # Name search works. But when searched for content, the search result does not provide any results. 
 # Even if the following system property is added into the setenv file to increase the allowed file size for PPTX, the search does not work for content:

{code}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Dofficeconnector.powerpoint.extractor.maxlength=209715200 ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}

h3. Expected Results

_Search for content from the PPTX file should yield results._
h3. Actual Results

_Currently the search is not yielding any results._
h3. Workaround

_None at this point._
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Search function does not work if PPTX file is more than 1B

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When deleting all page versions so only Current one remains, page header will only show "Created by <User>" tag with latest date page was modified, as if this page was never modified. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page or open an existing earlier created page by another user
 # Verify that you see {{Created by <User 1> on <Date>}} tag in page header:
!Screenshot 2021-11-22 at 18.32.40.png|thumbnail!
 # Edit the same page with a different or the same user and confirm you see {{Created by <User 2>, last modified on <Newer Date>}}
!Screenshot 2021-11-22 at 18.37.35.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to page History and delete older page versions, until only *Current* version remains
 # Go back to the page

h3. Expected Results
 # You still see {{Created by <User 1>, last modified on <Newer Date>}} tag as the page is not the original page

h3. Actual Results
 # Page will show {{Created by <User 1> on <Newer Date>}} tag, as if original user was created the page recently in it's current format
!Screenshot 2021-11-22 at 18.40.08.png|thumbnail!
Going into *Page Information* you can actually see that this is not the original page 
!Screenshot 2021-11-22 at 18.38.13.png|thumbnail!

As page history is erased, this is the only version of the page, hence why {{last modified on}} tags are dropped, but it's not accurate representation of page history. Any time Page Creation date does not match page modification date, {{last modified on}} should remain as this is no longer original page version by original author.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "last modified on <date>" field reverts back to "on <date>" if all page history is deleted

fields.description:
Confluence currently only supports the thin driver for connecting to an Oracle database. 

However, it's fair to assume that our larger Enterprise-level customers will want to enable things like Oracle Data Guard and Oracle TAF (Transparent Application Failover) in order to enact a failover process for their database. But in order to enable TAF, an OCI connection to the database is required.
fields.summary: Support OCI driver with Oracle

fields.description:
Query has poor performance on large CONTENT table. Please optimize it:

 
{code:java}
final String sqlString = "SELECT rt.currentId as contentId, rt.draftprevver as latestVersionid, rt.RELATIONID as relationId, " +
"CASE WHEN lt.LASTMODDATE < rt.touchdate THEN rt.CONTENT_STATUS ELSE lt.CONTENT_STATUS END as contentStatus, rt.touchdate as lastModifiedDate " +
"FROM CONTENT lt " +
"JOIN ( " +
"SELECT ucr.LASTMODDATE as touchdate, ucr.RELATIONID, c.LASTMODDATE, c.CONTENTID, " +
"c.TITLE, c.CONTENT_STATUS, coalesce(c.PREVVER, c.CONTENTID) as currentId, c.PREVVER as draftprevver " +
"FROM CONTENT c " +
"LEFT JOIN USERCONTENT_RELATION ucr " +
"ON c.CONTENTID = ucr.TARGETCONTENTID " +
"WHERE ucr.RELATIONNAME = 'touched' " +
"AND ucr.LASTMODIFIER = :userKey " +
" and c.CONTENTTYPE in (:contentTypes) " +
" and c.CONTENT_STATUS in (:contentStatuses) " +
") rt " +
"on lt.CONTENTID = rt.currentId " +
"WHERE lt.CONTENTID in (:contentIds)";

{code}
 

Using "coalesce(c.PREVVER, c.CONTENTID) as currentId" in subquery is bad idea. 

*EXPAIN on our database*

 
{quote}*************************** 1. row ***************************
id: 1
select_type: SIMPLE
table: lt
partitions: NULL
type: const
possible_keys: PRIMARY
key: PRIMARY
key_len: 8
ref: const
rows: 1
filtered: 100.00
Extra: NULL
*************************** 2. row ***************************
id: 1
select_type: SIMPLE
table: c
partitions: NULL
type: index
possible_keys: NULL
key: c_si_ct_pv_cs_cd_idx
key_len: 1559
ref: NULL
rows: 5356462
filtered: 4.00
Extra: Using where; Using index
*************************** 3. row ***************************
id: 1
select_type: SIMPLE
table: ucr
partitions: NULL
type: ref
possible_keys: u2c_relation_unique,relation_u2c_targetcontent_idx
key: relation_u2c_targetcontent_idx
key_len: 8
ref: confluencedb.c.CONTENTID
rows: 1
filtered: 4.92
Extra: Using where
3 rows in set, 1 warning (0.00 sec){quote}
Subquery is fetched 5356462 rows and after filtered it to 1 row.

*WORKAROUND*

Add extra condition in sub-query:

 
{code:java}
and (c.PREVVER in (:contentIds) or c.CONTENTID in (:contentIds)){code}
fields.summary: Optimize SQL query in com.atlassian.confluence.internal.persistence.hibernate.AbstractContentEntityObjectHibernateDao#queryContributionStatusByTouch

fields.description:
Direct Synchrony connections currently only allow connections over HTTP/WSS. 

In most scenarios terminating SSL at the proxy level is sufficient, but most US government agencies require end-to-end encryption for [NIST 800-53|https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf] compliance.

h3. Workaround 

Have Confluence proxy the requests to synchrony by setting the *synchrony.proxy.enabled* system property to true. See *With a reverse proxy* in [Possible Confluence and Synchrony Configurations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/possible-confluence-and-synchrony-configurations-958779064.html]
fields.summary: Allow SSL Connections Direct to Synchrony

fields.description:

Currently, we would need to do it manually by adding JQL filter with version on Confluence

Format could be

<List of bug issues><Summary>

Features
<List of feature issues><Summary>

Options
fields.summary: Auto Publish Jira Release notes to Confluence when a new version is released

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm excited to share that in Confluence Server we are adding an extra layer of security. You can now encrypt the database password that is stored in confluence.cfg.xml file with one of the encryption methods provided.

You can find more information in the https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EPassword/pages/1415995400/Encrypt+database+password docs.

This is really the same underlying issue as BSERV-10043, but applies to Confluence (as it should to all database passwords stored at rest for other Atlassian applications).

 We are following Jira and Bitbucket’s lead on this for the sake of a consistent admin experience. In Bitbucket It's an opt-in feature that requires an admin to make a choice about what type of Cipher, etc. their installation uses. But there is no specific instructions for Azure based installations.

Hence, suggestions needed here for configuration with docker and k8s helm charts encryption enabled?
fields.summary: Allow configuration with docker and k8s helm charts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Scrolling up and down in Confluence Data Center/Server Mobile App in iOS causes the comment section to eventually block the entire screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence and set it up normally
# Install [Confluence Data Center/Server|https://apps.apple.com/us/app/id1288365159] mobile app in iOS device
# Setup the Mobile App to connect to the fresh Confluence and browse to a page with a decent amount of content
#* The page needs to be long enough so that the user needs to scroll down to view all the content
# Flick down to reveal the comment section and continue to scroll up and down

h3. Expected Results
*Comment* section will be minimized when scrolled away from it

h3. Actual Results
*Comment* section slowly taking more and more portion of the screen but not minimizing despite user is scrolling _away_ from it
(i) A specific way of scrolling triggers this issue much more easily
 [^RPReplay_Final1637285361.mp4] - Video capture replicating the issue
 [^RPReplay_Final1637298797.mp4] - Video capture replicating the issue with gesture pointer (for more information how it is replicated)

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
 

h3. Test Environment
*Confluence*
Confluence 7.11.2
Confluence 7.11.1
Confluence 7.13.0

*iOS*
Software Version: 15.1

*Confluence Data Center/Server Mobile App*
Version 1.26.0.2
Version 1.25.0.1
fields.summary: Scrolling up and down in Confluence Data Center/Server Mobile App in iOS causes the comment section to eventually block the entire screen

fields.description:
Confluence takes a long time to open the editor when editing pages with lots of JIRA issues macros using the {*}total issue count{*}.

The CPU also spikes for a brief time during the editor loading time.
h3. How to replicate
 * JIRA 8.13.5
 * Confluence 7.13

1) Create a project on JIRA and add a few issues (2 for example).
2) Set the application links between Confluence and JIRA
3) Create a new page in Confluence and add a JIRA issue macro using the project created on number 1 above.
4) On the JIRA macro display options, select the *total issue count* display.
5) Save the page.

Editing the page with a single issue works fine. However, as we add more and more JIRA macros to the page with the "total issue count", the editor becomes slower each time.

Disabling the collaborative editor does not help.
The issue happens with simple and complex JIRA macro filters.
h3. Observed results

Editing the same page with more JIRA macros produced the following results:

1) Page with 10 JIRA issues = 5 seconds
2) Page with 50 JIRA issues = 8 seconds
3) Page with 100 JIRA issues = 12.6 seconds
4) Page with 250 JIRA issues = 19.5 seconds

As the number of issues on a page increases, the time to edit also continues increasing.

This HAR shows the behavior when loading the editor:
!HAR_loading_time.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Expected behavior

Confluence should open the page editor faster.
h3. Workaround

During tests, it was observed that changing the JIRA macro display mode to *table* renders the edit page really fast (under 5 seconds), even when using 250 JIRA macros on the same page.

The behavior seems tied to the *total issue count* display mode.
fields.summary: Edit pages with a lot of JIRA issues macros using "total issue count" takes a long time

h3. Issue Summary

Adding {{<aui-dropdown-menu>}} dropdown menu causes the editor to stop working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The editor can be used.

h3. Actual Results

The editor becomes unusable:

* Cannot scroll to the bottom of the editor content
* Some toolbar buttons are duplicated
* Several editor behaviours don't work as expected

h3. Issue Summary
When importing DOC or DOCX file with "+" (plus) symbol in file name will result in redirect to Page Not Found page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *.doc or *.docx file with + in file name (or download one attached here  [^test+document.docx] )
# Open a page in Confluence and click on {{***}} > Import Word Document
# Choose the earlier created *.doc or *.docx file and click Next
# Click *Import*

h3. Expected Results
* Document imported as is or split by heading (depending on earlier choice)

h3. Actual Results
* Document is imported and pages are created, but Confluence is redirected to Page Not Found like this:
 !Screenshot 2021-11-17 at 12.31.20.png|thumbnail! 
It seems like "+" character is covered to {{%2B}} in the URL to present the page, whereas Special Characters in page titles will force Confluence to display page using {{pages/viewpage.action?pageId=pageid}} format

h3. Workaround
Import will happen regardless of Page Not Found redirect. 
Removing special characters such as "+" from file names will prevent wrong redirect
fields.summary: Importing DOC with + in  file name Confluence redirects to Page Not Found

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Erroneous status is displayed on the UI when rebuilding and propagating index in a cluster if journal files are deleted manually. This may prevent admins from proceeding further.

!Overindexed.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a Confluence 7.7+ 2-node Datacenter
 # Go to node 1 -> Content indexing and perform a rebuild. Wait until it finishes and click Done.
 # Shut node 1 down. Delete its system maintenance journal at {*}<confluence-home>/journal/system_maintenance{*}. Start Confluence again.
 # Go to node 1 -> Content indexing and perform a rebuild

h3. Expected Results

Reindexing finishes without errors. The UI allow admins to click Done to wrap up the process.
h3. Actual Results

Index is successfully rebuilt in node 1 and propagated to node 2 but erroneous status is displayed. The UI hang at propagation and the Done button is not clickable.
h3. Workaround

 Use the following CURL request to acknowledge the reindex completion and restore the UI functionality:
{code:java}
curl -u <USER>:<PASSWORD> -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' http://<NODE-IP>:8090/rest/rebuildindex/latest/job/ack | python -mjson.tool
{code}
fields.summary: Content indexing UI may show erroneous status of Index propagation if journal files are deleted

*Expected result*

Users can quickly reach the search form and on searching, they understand that the search has been performed and how many results they got back.

*How to achieve that result*
 * add role=search for forms that contain search on pages
 * add role=status for "Displaying results..." text for AT to announce that results of the search are displayed on a page

 * add a way to clear the filter quickly, e.g. Add a "Clear the filter" link at the end of "Displaying..." 

Please note: [~eb6459a67784] was recently working on a similar issue in Jira [https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/JACCESS-1301]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's currently possible to synchronise users when their username ends with a space. Therefore, it makes it possible for these 2 users to exist in Confluence:
 * "admin" - _(no space at the end)_
 * "admin " - _(with a space at the end)_

This is detected as 2 different users in Confluence and both users will have separate records in the {{cwd_user}} and {{user_mapping}} table.

If you export the site to XML and attempt to re-import it later, the import will fail due to a unique constraint violation.
{code:java}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "unq_lwr_username"
  Detail: Key (lower_username)=(admin) already exists. {code}
The import process in Confluence strips the space at the end of the username, which results in Confluence attempting to insert the same username into the {{user_mapping}} table twice.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Synchronise 2 users to Confluence with identical usernames but one of them has a space at the end of their username.
 # Export the site to XML.
 # Create a new instance of the same version.
 # Import the XML backup.

h3. Expected Results

The XML restoration should succeed with no errors.
h3. Actual Results

The XML restoration fails with the below exception thrown in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file:
{code:java}
2021-11-12 11:03:38,069 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter] importEntities Cannot import the entities: 
 -- url: /longrunningtaskxml.action | referer: http://localhost:8090/admin/restore.action?synchronous=false | traceId: 01ac10c83e84fca5 | userName: admin | action: longrunningtaskxml
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import because the data does not match the constraints in the Confluence schema. Cause: PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "unq_lwr_username"
  Detail: Key (lower_username)=(admin) already exists. {code}
h3. Workaround

Ensure each user's username in Confluence is unique and not differentiated via a space character at the end of their username.
fields.summary: XML import fails with a unique constraint violation when a user contains a space at the end of a duplicated username

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are some operations on which the Confluence backend server will need to make HTTP requests to its Base URL.
As an example, during PDF page export it will load some CSS files through HTTP requests _to itself_.

If there are additional security in the environment, such as enforced authentication through a Load Balancer, then those operations will be affected by it.
For the page PDF export example, if some CSS files are not properly loaded, then the PDF won't show the expected formatting.

A visual example of this problem, when using the Info, Warning or Note macros, the PDF export won't render them properly as the image below.
While the page looks normal from the browser:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The PDF export won't render it correctly:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence should be less dependent on requests to its own Base URL, loading resources through the Java API.

h3. Workaround 
If enforcing authentication through a Load Balancer (or through a Marketplace App), then the administrator should configure a rule allowing unauthenticated requests from any Confluence node.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like Confluence being less dependent on requests to itself

fields.description:
ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR:
We are encountering scenarios where we use PageManager.movePageAsChild(...) and neither the page is moved nor any exception is thrown.
Judging from your implementation, this can be the case when no lock can be acquired for five minutes. Then some error is logged, but according method returns without having done the move and without throwing any exception.

DESIRED BEHAVIOUR:
As an app developer I want to rely on Java API methods either doing what they are designed for or throw some exception. Thus, I moving the page is not possible due to failing to acquire locks, please let the method throw some exception so I know the method was not successful.
fields.summary: Java API: Make PageManager.movePageAsChild Either Do The Job or Throw Exception

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tables with Date Picker in it cannot be sorted properly

h3. Environment
The issue has been tested and can be replicated in the browsers below:
* Chrome
* Firefox
* Edge

This issue is not observed in Confluence 7.13.0, but started since Confluence 7.13.1
|| Confluence Version || Sorting Column ||
| Confluence 7.13.0 | (/) |
| Confluence 7.13.1 | (x) |
| Confluence 7.13.2 | (x) |
| Confluence 7.14.0 | (x) |
| Confluence 7.14.1 | (x) |

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 7.13.1
# Create a blank page and insert a 3x3 table with heading column
# Insert Date Picker in any table cell, but leave at least 1 blank cell (that doesn't have a Date Picker) in the column
# Publish the page
# In View Mode, try to sort the table by clicking on the heading columns

h3. Expected Results
Data in the table can be sorted accordingly

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Full GC and OOME happened when preview pptx with big chart.

The customer is using a pptx file, which contains 17 charts.

If you open pptx file (change extension from pptx to zip, and use unzip command to unzip it), will notice some charts is bigger than 10MB.

!pptx_with_big_chart.png|thumbnail!

 

It seems very similar to [CONFSERVER-52279: PPTX File Conversion Service causes Sustained CPU Spike, OOME if the file contain charts|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52279]. However, it is closed.  so I created this ticket for tracking this problem.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload an pptx with big charts
 # Preview the pptx 

h3. Expected Results

It should be able to preview normally
h3. Actual Results

In customer's production environment, Confluence got unresponsive, full gc observed in customer side.
{code:java}
2021-11-05T17:23:53.441+0900: 391937.741: [Full GC (Allocation Failure)  40846M->24378M(40960M), 31.5930274 secs]
   [Eden: 0.0B(20480.0M)->0.0B(20480.0M) Survivors: 0.0B->0.0B Heap: 40846.8M(40960.0M)->24378.9M(40960.0M)], [Metaspace: 562441K->562433K(602112K)]
 [Times: user=54.07 sys=0.01, real=31.59 secs] 
{code}
In my test environment, OOME happened when preview the same pptx attachment.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Full GC and OOME happened when preview pptx with big chart

fields.description:
At the moment when a User Macro contain the following: {code:java}

{code} The resulting macro will translate the above, to a link as below:   !Screenshot 2021-11-10 at 00.08.28.png|thumbnail! When a user follows the link it leads to an empty page. The user can then add content to the page, this page remains accessible by the above link until this page is renamed. When the page is renamed, the above link will lead to an empty page again with the same title. This behaviour means that page links generated by User Macros, are not dynamic with every page rename.  h5. The Ask: Allow page links generated through User Macros to be dynamic with every page rename.
fields.summary: User Macros that include page links should have these links update when the referenced page title is changed

fields.description:
As the Confluence 7.15 version sets the xstream.allowlist.enable as true by default in the development mode that requires to use the xstream-security module.

When using compat-lib, xstream-security module seems not work with the given explanations in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/xstream-1-4-upgrade-1026045605.html]

*Cause*
It is found that security-module registration event registers the security module with core's and plugin's XStream, but not compat-lib's XStream reference. 
As part of quick solution, Confluence team would try to lazify the XStream reference in XStreamManagerCompat class.

That provokes:
{{com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.ServiceException: Could not deserialize object as XStream might not be properly initialized}}

*Workaround*
If Confluence is running through amps, configure confluence JVM sysprop `xstream.allowlist.enable` to `false` using systemPropertyVariables. Please read more about setting system properties on its [amps documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/maven-amps-plugin/3.2-m5-newer-products/maven-amps-plugin/run-mojo.html#systemPropertyVariables].
fields.summary: Confluence 7.15 xstream-security module not working in dev mode with compat lib

fields.description: We use Page Properties and Page Property Reports often within our company. I have an instance where the report with each page as a row isn't very readable, and it would be incredibly helpful to be able to simply swap rows and columns to make it more readable. Please consider adding this option!
fields.summary: Page Properties Report - add ability to swap rows and columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When adding a Widget Connector Macro with a link to youtube video, if the Confluence server does not have access to the internet, the macro will not add anything to the page, as you have clicked cancel. It works fine for other video sites like Yahoo or Vimeo.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

[^widgetconnector.mov]
 

Try to add a video from youtube to Widget Connector, if internet access is not available to the server.
h3. Expected Results

_The macro should be added, and video should be available to see in the browser._
h3. Actual Results

_Nothing is added._
h3. Workaround

_Sometimes, placing the youtube link direct to the page will have it converted to the Widget Macro._
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Cannot add youtube video via widget connector without internet connection

fields.description:
Currently as mentioned in the page [Page Restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-restrictions-139414.html] if we limit a page to be edited by a user o a group the user will be restricted to edit both pages titles and their content. 
More detailed permission management could be created so the administrator can define if, for example, a certain group is able to edit a page content but not its title. 
That way the content creation would not be compromised and the page file structure that is defined for a space can be respected.
fields.summary: Include more detailed permissions for Confluence pages.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to upload a site logo within a fresh 7.14.0 Confluence instance after a site logo is reset to default, then Collaborative Editing is disabled. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Workaround

Here is a workaround which should allow you to successfully upload the logo.
 # Shutdown Confluence
 # Query the Confluence database to get the contentid of the globaldescription by running following query: 
{code:sql}
select contentid from content where contenttype = 'GLOBALDESCRIPTION'; {code}
 # Update contentproperties table with the contentid returned from the above query.  
{code:sql}
update contentproperties set stringval = 'synchrony' where contentid = <contentid_from_above>;{code}
 # Restart Confluence
 # Login and verify that you are able to update the logo successfully
{panel:bgColor=#e5e5e5}
(i) This workaround requires Confluence to be shutdown. Please perform this activity during a scheduled maintenance window or other period of low activity to limit impact to users.
----
(i) This workaround also requires manipulation of the Confluence database. Please follow best practices and ensure database backups are created prior to executing the below SQL statements.
{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Functions that rely on methods to work with files and attachments (including images) are failing after collaborative editing is disabled.

The following methods have been identified so far:
- {{saveAttachment()}} and {{removeAttachmentVersionFromServer()}} from the Confluence Java API https://docs.atlassian.com/ConfluenceServer/javadoc/7.4.9/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/AttachmentManager.html
- {{storeResource()}} from the Confluence Java API https://docs.atlassian.com/ConfluenceServer/javadoc/7.4.9/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/FileUploadManager.html

This leads to significant side effects for customer:
- users are not able to upload a profile picture using the functionality provided by Confluence natively
- using apps because PersonalInformation of a user (including the profile picture) cannot be retrieved, updated and used by apps with disabled Collaborative Editing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce - based on the user profile use case
 # Open the user profile page
 # Attempt to upload a new image

h3. Expected Results - based on the user profile use case
Everything works as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the Confluence logs:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.pages.exceptions.ExternalChangesException: Unable to save changes to unreconciled page null
at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.content.collab.DefaultContentReconciliationManager.reconcileIfNeeded(DefaultContentReconciliationManager.java:149)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Enabling collaborative editing at a later stage doesn't resolve the problem. Once the collaborative editing option has been disabled, the problem will remain even after re-enabling it.

Currently Confluence relies on the {{getContentId}} but it is not available for the {{PersonalInformation}} which is where the attachments are stored in this case.

This has been introduced with the https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55928 fix, so all Confluence versions including the change until a fix for this issue is released are affected.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Functions that rely on methods to work with files and attachments (including images) are failing after collaborative editing is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In *Confluence Server/Data Center*, there is no way to set a fixed width for the entire table, making it hard for the editor to align multiple tables in the same page nicely for easy reading.
This is because resizing each column's width would always impact the _maximum table width_ as shown in the screenshot below:
 !server resize width.png|thumbnail! 

When there are more tables in one page, it quickly becomes a very tedious job for the editing person to align each of the tables in order to have the same column/table width if they'd want to have every table sharing the same width/layout.
 !server multiple tables.png|thumbnail! 


*Confluence Cloud* on the other hand, always have the *Table Width* set to a fixed width so resizing the columns will not impact the maximum table width. This allows the editing person to be able to form a unified table structure across the entire page:
 !cloud resize table.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow editor to configure the width of each column and table so the editing person can easily unify the table structure using absolute numbers rather than dragging with the cursor.
(i) Refers to the _Workaround_ below, but having a proper UI for this instead

h3. Workaround
Install [Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?hosting=server&tab=overview] and edit the source manually to set *Table Width* and *Column Width*:
 !source editor.png|thumbnail! 
 !edited result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow configuration of Width for Table and Columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence allows you to insert Jira issue dates (using default or custom fields) into the Team Calendar by creating an event.

However, if your custom field is configured with a context restricted to a project along with global context type, custom field does not appear in TC events when choosing a different project.
* +Environment Details:+
 ** Confluence 7.12.5
 ** Jira 8.13.10
 ** Team Calendar 7.1.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Applink between Jira and Confluence.
 # Create two Sample Project in Jira: Project-{{Sample}} and Project- {{My Project}}
 # Create a Custom field in Jira (Eg: {{Start Date}})
 # Add an additional Context to {{*Start Date*}} and add project-{{My Project}} to it
 # Add {{*Start Date*}} custom field to Create Issue Screen of Project-{{Sample}}
 # Try creating an Issue from Jira UI under Project-{{Sample}} and could see the 'Start Date' field in Jira UI create Screen
 !Screenshot 2021-11-03 at 7.57.55 PM.png!
 # In Confluence, create a calendar and try to create an event of type "Jira Issue Dates".
 # Select Project- {{Sample}}
 # {{*Start Date*}} custom field is not shown in UI
 !Screenshot 2021-11-03 at 8.01.19 PM.png!

h3. Expected Results
The custom field {{Start Date}} should show up when creating Jira Issues Dates event in TC.

h3. Actual Results
The custom field {{Start Date}} does not show up when creating Jira Issues Dates event in TC.

h3. Workaround
 * Add the context to custom field ({{Start Date}}) explicitly to Project-{{Sample}} for it populate in TC events in Confluence.
fields.summary: Jira's custom date field doesn't appear when creating TC event if the custom field context is restricted to a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Firefox does not displays pictures inside section macro in conjunction with note macro where as Chrome and Safari displays all contents
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page and give a page title
 # In the body of the page write some words such as Hello
 # Add a section macro after that and publish the page
 # Edit the page again
 # Write few lines such as *Line 1* and then hit enter to come to a new line and write *Line 2* and so on.
 # Add a note macro now at the end *inside this section macro* and publish the page.
 # +*Its observed that Line 1 is only displayed in Firefox*+ where rest of the lines are not displayed but this works fine as tested with chrome and safari
 # Now edit the page again and either delete the note macro or place the note macro outside the section macro.
 # Now, the contents are displayed fine in firefox
 # The same issue is observed while having screenshots instead of lines
 # The issue is not seen if we have only one screenshot without any lines or one single line in conjunction with note macro. In a nutshell, any content on line 1 is displayed but nothing after line 1 whether its a word/sentence or picture when used with note macro ( recording and few screenshots attached )

h3. Expected Results

Firefox should display all lines or all pictures/attachments inside section macro while used with Note macro
h3. Actual Results

Firefox is not displaying all lines or all pictures/attachments inside section macro while used with Note macro
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Firefox does not displays pictures inside section macro in conjunction with note macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a Confluence page, attach a word document where the document's content has a bullet point in the Courier font (default Microsoft Office empty-circle bullet).
 In the resulting preview, the page containing the Courier font bullet point will appear to be blank.
 Clicking on an empty space on the seemingly blank page preview, and then dragging down (to mimic text being highlighted) will reveal that text does exist, but is completely transparent, and therefore unreadable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

With Confluence installed on a Windows Server, attach the sample doc (*{{[^Sample.docx]}}*) to a Confluence page, and click on it to generate the document preview.

h3. Expected Results
Each of the 4 pages should have a visible/readable preview.

h3. Actual Results
The preview for the page which contains the Courier font bullet point will appear blank, but it does have the original text that's completely transparent/invisible (see attached *{{issue_screenshot.png}}*).

h3. Workaround
Highlight the bullet in the source document, change the font from Courier to Windings, or use a different fixed width font like Consolas, and attach the modified document in place of the original to re-generate a fully-visible preview.

(i) *Note*: the issue may also appear in the previews for PDF files containing the Courier font/bullet; the workaround of changing the font in the PDF to a different fixed width font still applies.
fields.summary: Confluence on Windows Server - Courier font bullet point on a page in an attached document leads to that page's preview showing up as blank/empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user changes the attachment title to just blank spaces, Confluence accepts the change and it is committed to the database.
Committing this change results on some undesired state for an attachment file as below:
 * The name of the attachment on the _Attachments_ screen doesn't exist, making it impossible to open the file without additional steps.
 * Trying to insert the file to the page results on an error.
  ** On the UI the user sees a message as "There was an error processing the request".
  ** On the application logs the administrator may find an entry similar to the below.
{code}
2021-11-01 23:06:04,826 WARN [http-nio-27130-exec-3] [content.render.xhtml.DefaultFormatConverter] validateAndConvertToStorageFormat XhtmlException converting editor format to storage format. Turn on debug level logging to see editor format data.
 -- referer: http://localhost:27130/c7130/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=360479&draftShareId=a662c9c7-9c2e-419c-bcff-8ebab03efb03& | url: /c7130/rest/api/content/360478 | traceId: 7776b4b3468ab1d9 | userName: admin
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (filename cannot be null or blank.)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.editor.EditorXhtmlTransformer.transform(EditorXhtmlTransformer.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.TransformerChain.transform(TransformerChain.java:33)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.TransformerChain.transform(TransformerChain.java:33)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PluggableTransformerChain.transform(PluggableTransformerChain.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.editor.DefaultEditorConverter.convert(DefaultEditorConverter.java:37)
(...)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: filename cannot be null or blank.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.model.resource.identifiers.AttachmentResourceIdentifier.<init>(AttachmentResourceIdentifier.java:17)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.editor.macro.MacroParameterTypeParserImpl.resolveFullAttachment(MacroParameterTypeParserImpl.java:308)
{code}
 * If the file was being used within a {{view-file}} macro in a page, before the file name was changed to spaces, then reverting it won't automatically change the page storage format, breaking the {{view-file}} macro.
 * If an export is created on this condition, then an import fails as reported on bug [CONFSERVER-74538|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-74538].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with sample content and publish it.
 # Go to the _Attachments_ screen of that page.
 # Upload a new file as an attachment.
 # Click on the *Properties* button related to this attachment.
 # On the _File Name_ field, delete the current name and add just a space.
 # Click on *Save*.

h3. Expected Results
The modification isn't saved and the user receives and information on the UI explaining a file name with just spaces isn't allowed.
The modification isn't committed to the database.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence accepts the modification of the file name to just blank spaces, saving and committing the change to the database.

h3. Workaround
Confluence administrators can run a SQL query to identify attachments on which the file name is composed of only blank spaces and then chank.
{code:sql}
select c.* from content c where c.contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT' and c.lowertitle ~ '[[:space:]]+';
{code}
fields.summary: Changing the title of an attachment on Confluence to just blank spaces doesn't result on an error and commits the change on the database

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Because of bug [CONFSERVER-74539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-74539] Confluence allows attachments with a file name with just blanks spaces.
If this situation exists on an XML export, then the import fails with a {{NullPointerException}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of Confluence.
  #* This was validated on Confluence *7.13.0* and *7.4.11*.
 # Create a page with an attachment.
 # Change the attachment name to just blank spaces.
  #* See additional instructions on bug [CONFSERVER-74539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-74539].
 # Go to *Cog icon* > *General configuration* > *Backup & Restore*.
 # Create a site export.
 # Move the generated export {{.zip}} file to {{<confluence-home>/restore}}
 # Go to *Cog icon* > *General configuration* > *Backup & Restore*.
 # Import the XML file.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence completes the import, gracefully dealing with an attachment with just spaces as the {{title}} and {{lowertitle}}.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails, mostly at the end of the operation {{>80%}}.
The following entries are found on the application logs.
{code}

	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.RestoreBandanaValuesTransactionCallbackDecorator.doInTransaction(RestoreBandanaValuesTransactionCallbackDecorator.java:56)

(...)

 -- url: /c7130/longrunningtaskxml.action | referer: http://localhost:27130/c7130/admin/restore-local-file.action | traceId: 7596f26feabbc969 | userName: admin | action: longrunningtaskxml

h3. Workaround
If the source instance is still available, then the administrator can:
 # Search for the attachments on which the file name is just blank spaces.
  #* See the details on [CONFSERVER-74539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-74539].
 # Change the file name to something meaningful.
 # Create a new export.

\\
\\
If the source instance isn't available anymore then the administrator can manually edit the {{entities.xml}} file of the available XML export, changing the attachment name directly in the file and creating a new {{.zip}} file with the modified {{entities.xml}}.
You may choose opening a request to Atlassian Support to get help identifying this situation and making the appropriate changes to that file.
fields.summary: Confluence import fails with a NullPointerException if the XML export has an attachment with just spaces as a file name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Space migration via CCMA fails with NPE on Confluence Server 7.14
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluece DC 7.14 version
 # Import the XML space export in the confluence server.
 # Create a migration plan and run the migration.
 # The migration of space fails with the below error and NPE observed in the Confluence server log file.

{code:java}
Failed to export [cloudId=xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx,fileId=xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx,spaceKey=XXXXXX]{code}
h3. Expected Results

Migration is successful
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

Failed to export [cloudId=1d5d253f-87ec-42ff-9043-362fe347bacc,fileId=3fbd0bf0-c4aa-49d6-a42f-e9cc4010458b,spaceKey=NORMA]

{"spaceKey":"XXX","fileId":"xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx","cloudId":"xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"}

A possible workaround might be to downgrade Confluence to 7.13.x

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create a table with multiple rows and merge the cells of a column to span multiple rows, it adds extra space to an adjacent column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a three column table with six rows, first column is the header column
# Merge the top five cells of the third column
# Add content to table, in the third column with merged cells add a lot of content like multiple macros and text 

h3. Expected Results

The table renders properly without extra space. 

h3. Actual Results

The first row of non-merged cells expands as far as content in the column with merged cells

!bad-table-rendering.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Merging cells in a column adds extra space to adjacent column

fields.description:
Researchers at the University of Cambridge reported a vulnerability affecting Confluence Server / DC where special characters, known as Unicode bidirectional override characters, are not rendered or displayed in the affected applications. These special characters are typically not displayed by the browser or code editors but can affect the meaning of the source code when it is processed by a compiler or an interpreter. The issue is now fixed.

*Affected versions:*
 * All versions before 7.4.13

 * All versions between 7.5.0 and 7.12.5 (inclusive)

 * All 7.13.x LTS versions before 7.13.2

 * Version 7.14.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 7.4.13

 * 7.13.2

 * 7.14.1
fields.summary: Unicode characters allow malicious code to be hidden from a human reviewer (Confluence Server) - CVE-2021-42574
